messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid
messages.msgSnippet: I have a hard time reading with my finger underneath the words (the way Duncan would PREFER that I read! ) because I get snagged on each word. It s not
messages.messageBody:
"I have a hard time reading with my finger underneath the words (the way
Duncan would PREFER that I read! ) because I get snagged on each word. It's not
natural for me."

I too read in a swirly kind of pattern. I can read rather quickly as well. (that last email wasn't hard for me to read at all) To be forced to stop at every word is very frusterating! My oldest daughter (6yrs) wants me to put my finger under every word and its so hard to read that way! lol

BB,
Ana





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/27/2004 5:13:26 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I didn t really find it harder, per-se, just slower. I don t read with my finger underneath,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/27/2004 5:13:26 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
kbcdlovejo@... writes:

> I think it depends on *how* you read. I read several lines at once and
> forward and backward and kind of "swirly"---as Sandra puts it. So it's
> REALLY easy
> for me to read.
>
> I have a hard time reading with my finger underneath the words (the way
> Duncan would PREFER that I read! ) because I get snagged on each word. It's
> not
> natural for me.
>

I didn't really find it harder, per-se, just slower. I don't read with my
finger underneath, but I do tend to skip over several words at a time and read
very fast. I had to read each word and kind of "double check" they were what I
assumed. Typos seem to jump out at me, too, so maybe that has something to do
with it.

Sang


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid
messages.msgSnippet: When I first read it, a while back, I didn t even realize something was wrong with it.  Took me a few seconds to figure that out.  Weird how different brains
messages.messageBody:
When I first read it, a while back, I didn't even realize something was
wrong with it. Took me a few seconds to figure that out. Weird how
different brains work.

Angela
<mailto:game-enthusiast@...> game-enthusiast@...

it took me about 4 times longer to read this
paragraph than it would a similar length paragraph that wasn't... "muddled"
,
if you will. :~) But that's my problem! LOL<<<<


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/27/2004 4:51:40 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Sanguinegirl83@aol.com writes: wouldn t say WITHOUT problem-it took me about 4 times longer to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/27/2004 4:51:40 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Sanguinegirl83@... writes:
wouldn't say WITHOUT problem-it took me about 4 times longer to read this
paragraph than it would a similar length paragraph that wasn't... "muddled" ,
if you will. :~) But that's my problem! LOL<<<<

I think it depends on *how* you read. I read several lines at once and
forward and backward and kind of "swirly"---as Sandra puts it. So it's REALLY easy
for me to read.

I have a hard time reading with my finger underneath the words (the way
Duncan would PREFER that I read! ) because I get snagged on each word. It's not
natural for me.

~Kelly

Peace,

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid
messages.msgSnippet: I ve seen this before...isn t it great? Not that my kids are reading better, I d like them to try. Some kids I ve heard have trouble reading it.  Especially if
messages.messageBody:
I've seen this before...isn't it great?
Not that my kids are reading better, I'd like them to try.
Some kids I've heard have trouble reading it. Especially if they haven't been reading long.
What did other find?
Ann
----- Original Message -----
From: James & Lari Johnston
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 27, 2004 12:25 PM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the pweor of the hmuan mnid


thought some here might find this interesting :)


Aoccdrnig to rscheearch codnutced at Cmabrigde Uinervtisy, it deosn't mttaer in waht orede the ltteers in a wrod are tpyed, the olny iprmoetnt tihng is taht the frist and lsat ltteer be in the rghit oedrer. The rset can be a total mses and you can sitll raed it wouthit porbelm. Tihs is bcuseae the huamn mnid deos not raed ervey lteter by istlef, but the wrod as a wlohe. Amzanig, huh?

Lari in Indiana
